Reviews.Title: I love this computer!
Reviews.Author: Momo
Reviews.Content: I don't know why the reviews for this computer are low.  I got this computer and love it!  For the price I paid, it's such a steal.  The screen is huge and it's not heavy at all. The sound is pretty good and the keyboard is very functional.  I like that it has a DVD/CD burner, a built in web camera and so far, it hasn't frozen on me at all.  It shuts off and on how it's supposed to and there's no complaints I can really make about it since my time of purchase.Windows 8 could take some getting used to, but that has nothing to do with the physicality of the computer itself.  I usually own desktops and have had an apple laptop so this is my second laptop purchase.  It's been a very smooth transition with using this computer.

Reviews.Title: good desktop replacement
Reviews.Author: outlaw164 "webmaster"
Reviews.Content: Only reason I bought this laptop, from a different merchant, was to replace my HP business class 17" laptop running Windows XP Pro. Since Microsoft won't be supporting XP after April 8, 2014 I figured now was the time to pull the trigger on a new one by taking advantage of after-Christmas overstock price reductions.I also own a Dell Alienware desktop running Windows 7 Pro, so the leap to Windows 8 wasn't all that dramatic on this HP Pavilion. Yes, there are certain features on Win 8 that I don't care for, but it's not a deal breaker. After all, Win 8 and its successors are here to stay for the future, so better pony up to change and get used to it.Installing the free Windows 8.1 upgrade was a plus. Start button is back, sort of, just not the familiar Start that Vista and Win 7 users are used to. Had to hunt for the Jump Lists. Haven't created a shortcut for them yet. Comes loaded with a ton of apps I'll likely not use, only a few useful ones that interest me.Nice bright screen and decent sound. Color rendition is a bit lacking in the saturation department. Color calibration doesn't help much. If I were a student I'd better hit the gym and lift weights. Wouldn't cherish lugging this hefty rascal from class to class.All in all, I'm satisfied with its performance. Plenty fast with enough horsepower to do what I want with a portable PC. Only use it when away from home on business and pleasure. I became very spoiled with my older HP 17", so I just had to jump on this one. Glad I did.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: maeschus
Reviews.Content: bought this as a replacement of my 2 nd half year old Acer laptop that has Win 7. So far, this laptop works perfectly fine and fast. I love how big the screen and yet its not that heavy. The keyboard is lot better than my previous one. Overall, great item and affordable. I just have to get used of windows 8 which is still kinda confusing to me.

Reviews.Title: Really like this computer!
Reviews.Author: jpaden01
Reviews.Content: I have never really had a laptop before, so this is my first. My old standby computer, I think I have had for almost 10 years now. And would gladly still be doing everything on it If Microsoft had not killed Windows XP. But I couldn't very well stuff it in a bag and go either.  So at least this lets me take it on a trip.What I do like so far: Graphics look nice.  I listened to a little music on it and was pleased with the quality of the speakers.  Surprisingly clear. Didn't sound tinny.  The screen is large with good picture quality.  However, it is bright!  If you are one of those people who has trouble with going to sleep after watching TV or computing, I strongly suggest a pair of the yellow glasses (blue-blockers).As I learn my way around it I find I am starting to like the way it works.  I would give it 5 stars if it were not for the internal mouse.  I found it to be too touchy.  I would recommend using an external.  I am using a Logitech 3M10 instead of the built in mouse at this time and find it much easier for my personal use.  One thing I did like about the built in mouse was how easy it is to pan in and out on the screen.Overall, I find I am really liking this computer.  If I so wished, I could replace my old desktop with it.  I sometimes have to laugh at myself for the things I have overlooked.For instance; It does have an HDMI connection for hooking up to a television.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Price
Reviews.Author: Adrian Castro Furniss
Reviews.Content: Great Service and price, the computer arrived safely, big screen, all for a low price with great potential, excellent buy

Reviews.Title: I am sick of talking to hp support!!!
Reviews.Author: gloria kohnen "Ggk"
Reviews.Content: I bought this from micro center because I had purchased another computer from amazon and had to send it back because of a personal preference issue and I did not want to be stuck with a postage charge again.I have the same issue of the computer not shutting down and having to hold the power button for an extended time to shut the machine down. I was instructed by hp to do this.Finally, after four calls to support and their trying to fix the issue, they want to have the computer back so they can repair it.It will take THREE weeks! I have barely owned the computer for that long! And I will have to reinstall software for the Wacom tablet and photoshop elements 11!I am taking pictures of the computer before I send it back because they said if there are any damage issues, these are not covered under warranty.I have read other reviews that have had a difference of opinion between owner and repair as to damage.I intend to protect myself from charges.By the way, possible future owners of this machine, hp support says that this shut down issue is a known issue with this machine. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: Hubby loved it
Reviews.Author: Medic Chick
Reviews.Content: Bought this for mu husband when his last HP pavilion died. He loves the speed, the aesthetics, the software etc. He will probably be an HP lover for life. HP has continued to put out great and price appropriate products consistently.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop but...........
Reviews.Author: caleb Long
Reviews.Content: It's a great laptop!I work from home on the computer, so having a decent computer is obviously a must.  Before I got my stay-at-home job, I had a very nice Toshiba laptop, which one of the USB ports went bad. With only 2 USB ports, and only one working, I know I would dare to try to talk with Toshibas Support Group, I thought it was time for a new laptop. I did some searching and this one seemed to be the best. So, I purchased it.In the two days it took to get here (Thanks Amazon Prime!), I broke out the old solder gun and successfully fixed the USB on my other laptop. Now, without a factory solder, it's probably a little (or A LOT) more fragile -- long story short, I now use that laptop more as a desktop. Enough story telling...I got the package and I'm very happy! It's over a great, fast, beautiful, laptop that I actually like better than my (sorry Steve Jobs) MacBook.Hmmm, why the two star rating?Exactly a month and four days after I bought it, I was booting up, and noticed a bright, blue dot. Stuck pixel, huh?! I tried every method to fix it, but it just won't go away.I'm normally not that picky, and it's only one pixel, but when my whole screen's black and there's one really bright dot... It can really make someone that has self-diagnosed OSD go %$&$(#*&%$$#!??!!??!?!?!?!Don't let this swing your opinion one way or the other, because I'm almost 100% sure it won't happen to you. Besides that one pixel, this is really a five star rating.

Reviews.Title: Just what i was looking for :-)
Reviews.Author: jessica Degracia
Reviews.Content: Love it!!! I'm just having a problem getting used to Windows 8.1. I don't even know where to start to go to Microsoft Word! But overall, I LOVE IT! Perfect for what I purchased it for.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CHOICE!!!
Reviews.Author: Bobbi K. Bowles "buttercup"
Reviews.Content: I"m very impressed with this computer. I am not a computer guru, so this one works out very well for me. It's very east to navigate, figured Windows 8 out very easily. Very fast! It is a great choice for me! I would highly recommend this one to anybody!

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion 17-e040us 17-Inch Laptop
Reviews.Author: William D Whitaker
Reviews.Content: HP builds a great laptop and this one is no exception.  Speed is good for a laptop and the keyboard feel is very good.  The large display is very clear and the text is crisp.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied with Seller, but not with product
Reviews.Author: C. Novotny
Reviews.Content: Order my HP Notebook on 2/7/14 and received it on 2/15/14.  On 3/11/14, the notebook ceased closing down using the Settings/Power shut down and would only shut down by pressing the on/off button.  I was on the phone with tech support for 2 hours hoping to fix the issue without having to send the laptop back.  No luck, was told it was a hardware problem and I had to send back to HP.  I spent days and days downloading software, photos, music and files that contained sensitive information.  Now I will have to go and delete the sensitive files to secure the data and then reload again.  Have no idea what, if anything, will be lost though HP says they will backup.  It's uncomfortable to send a laptop to a stranger fearing "snooping" of sensitive data that I may forget to delete.  It seems unreasonable to have a hardware failure less than a month after receiving the laptop.  Of course, I've already paid for it, so I'm a bit concerned about that as well.  While the Notebook was working, I was happy with it, and this is my first experience with an HP laptop.  So far, not very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic tech specs
Reviews.Author: Donald R. Chance
Reviews.Content: Arrived as scheduled. Well packaged. Have not given it a big workout yet but expect no problems. Price was much better than I saw in the big box stores. Not a big fan of Windows 8, but that's a different issue. Technical specs on this machine are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavillion 17"
Reviews.Author: Michelle A. Todd "Michelle"
Reviews.Content: Love it!  The speed and clarity on this computer is exceptional.  Although I didn't order it with Microsoft Products, I was able to purchase it separately and it is just what I needed to do what I need to do.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion 17-e040us 17-Inch Laptop (2.4GHz 4th generation Intel Core I3
Reviews.Author: victormanuel3007
Reviews.Content: Im not a fan of HP laptops but this model is great, looks great and works great. if you like to navegate on internet, use many applications or maybe use some Adobe Master Collection programs, this laptop will works fine for all that. A great option for sure, i recomended it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent supplier
Reviews.Author: James Hurst, Jr.
Reviews.Content: It was exactly what I wanted and exactly what I ordered. There were no signs of damage.  I am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Big screen!
Reviews.Author: A-Chan
Reviews.Content: This is my replacement for my 2 1/2 year old Gateway with a dying motherboard. I've never used an HP before, but right now HP's are the highest rated laptops (at least from what I can interpret), and I decided to branch out with this Pavilion. My needs were as follows:6 GB of RAM or higherAMD processor OR Intel i3/i4/i5DVD/CD burner and built-in webcam and micUSB 2.0 and USB 3.0Port for storage cardsWindows 8.1Don't die on m after only 2 years!!!It has already met these needs, except for the last one, it's only been on for a few hours.I'm a gamer, especially fond of Minecraft which is a painfully laggy game and I decided I would spend a little more money and get 6 GB of RAM and a better processor. After about 10 minutes on the internet I realized just how awful my Gateway's processor was and how slow it was in general. My Pavilion is probably 3 times as fast!As far as Windows 8 is concerned... it works fine on this computer, and my only complaint is Windows 8 requires a lot of clicking and unclicking around and the texture of the mousepad isn't very sensitive so I have to tap it pretty hard to select things. Even if that wasn't a problem I was going to get a mouse anyways, it's just very annoying.My fave features are the number-pad, since I've been without one for a while. The size and resolution of the screen is fantastic. Watching stuff on Netflix feels more like a TV screen, which is wonderful. I have all of my settings the way I like them with Windows, and I found new settings I didn't know existed before (like turning off the start-up/volume lever/cursor at the end of a sentence/etc annoyingly unnecessary ping noises)..Very quiet keyboard, and it's nice to eat food around my laptop and know crumbs won't get stuck under the keys. There are plenty of HP and Windows help guides too.I'm having an awful time getting Norton Internet Security to uninstall. I use Panda Cloud Antivirus, which works better and is free. I've had terrible experiences with Norton in the past and even though I went through the uninstall process, I keep finding Norton related settings, something I told it to NOT keep on my computer. If there was an option to say don't install Norton when I bought this laptop, I would've done it.Overall I am very happy with this laptop and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Rating The Laptop NOT Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Bradley S. Stonecypher
Reviews.Content: Geez people, go over to the software area to rant about windows 8.  Personally, the laptop is a bit big, but I couldn't resist the $400.00 price for a 17 inch screen.The keyboard is quiet and the trackpad is rather large which for my fat fingers is great.  My only slight complaint is that the keyboard is not back lit since I do most of my laptopping in the dark or near dark.Interesting that the spec here says it can only go up to 8gb of Ram, but on Crucial's site it says 16gb.For a basic laptop and for my use, it is an incredible piece of machinery.In closing, rate the laptop not the OS!!!

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion 17-e040us 17-Inch Laptop(2.4GHz 4th generation Intel Core i3-4000M Processor,6GB DDR3L SD ram,750GB 5400RPM hard
Reviews.Author: Margo
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat apprehensive when opening this purchase as the last one, same brand/same price had definite problems as the cd player sticking constantly and the touchpad would stop working @ different times.  I found that  there were similar complaints.  Unfortunately for me I should have returned it sooner.I was soo very pleased with this one after typing a review/wordpad for ANY periods lol and placing cds numerous times over and over making sure no more problems.  I waited before reviewing this one and now ready to give it a big 5 plus!  All pros and no cons that I could find.  Windows 8 proved hard to get use to but keep using it and you'll see it does get easier.

Reviews.Title: good cheap laptop
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Laptop works great. I really do not windows 8. Slowly working the kinks out. But overall for the price it works great.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion 17-e040us 17-inch Laptop (2,4GHz 4 generation Intel Core
Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop mainly because of the large inch.  This one is new to me but I am learning it daily.  Everything is at your finger tips and so easy and fast to just click and download your apps.  This laptop is just loaded with everything that you can imagine and some apps that you may have not even thought of.  It is really a great buy and I am so happy that I purchased it.  Enjoy your journey in using this fantastic machine.

Reviews.Title: I Love My New Computer.
Reviews.Author: Cherylshatzer
Reviews.Content: I went from windows 7 and had read all the reviews about windows 8. They didn't seem to positive . Not sure what the advantage of updating to 8.1, it keeps asking me if I want to. Maybe someone can tell me why I should. I like the fact that the screen is 17 inches. I like to see what I'm looking at. I had a little trouble at first because of the difference in the set-up of the screen and it took a little getting used to. It's fast, the only thing I notice is sometimes when I'm playing my music it pauses, not sure if it's my cheap Brighthouse internet or the computer. Plays my dvd's fine. Haven't watched any netfix or online movies yet to see if there is a difference. Did not go with the touch screen, I love to type. But my next computer I might try it. I went to support first thing, because the book they send is not very through. But I called support twice and even though they are in the Philipines. (Is anything in US anymore?) they were great ,even called me back when they said they would, and made sure I had all my questions answered. Still have a lot to learn about what I can do and excited to find out. When I got this computer it was 519. So I notice the price has jumped up a little. After I have had it for a while I will post again and see what else I can do with it.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: astrid smith
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with the computer itself.  One thing - if I had known it that Windows 8 should have touch screen to optimize use it would have been helpful

Reviews.Title: Love the huge display (Not a touch screen)
Reviews.Author: hmongPop
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop around Thanksgiving 2013 on Black Friday. So far its pretty solid and well worth the buy.If you know your way around computers, Windows 8 won't bother you as much~ I would recommend getting Windows 8.1 which basically just lets you use the Desktop as your homepage. I do not use Window 8's start menu. The Start menu default applications for opening videos, pictures, and etc are not suited for general purpose computing. They are stylish but take up too much space on the screen especially while multitasking.HP also adds there own Start button (HP Quick Start) which greatly helps find applications and programs.I do some video editing here and there; like most laptops, the rendering is pretty slow.For general purpose computing, this laptop is more than enough.

Reviews.Title: COMPUTER
Reviews.Author: Bluejay
Reviews.Content: THE COMPUTER IS GOOD HAVING A FEW ISSUES WITH WINDOWS 8 ISSUES although they are working out as i come more familar with it

Reviews.Title: Good laptop
Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: I would've preferred a laptop with Windows 7 but I'm glad Windows 8 has desktop capabilities. Great for the price. Fast, easy to navigate (minus the tab section)... I would recommend this for anyone who loves to browse, watch videos, download music. Only thing I can complain about is you have to buy Microsoft Office.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Sam Brannan
Reviews.Content: I love this computer, but Windows 8 is tough for an old man , had to install 8.1 and my son helped me set it up , and now everything is hunkadory.

Reviews.Title: HP product is great
Reviews.Author: Sue Gilman
Reviews.Content: The laptop is very nice, large screen, easy keyboard, no problems with the HP.The bad thing is Windows 8 ! I hate it! I should have researched more about Windows before I bought this. It was for my 90 year old dad, since he had XP and needed a new product. Can't tell you how much I hate it!

Reviews.Title: hp excellent
Reviews.Author: anthony Heck
Reviews.Content: This HP laptop far exceed what I was expected in terms of performance. Fast, simple and good product. My first personal 17 inch is great for viewing purposes. I recommend this hp laptop. HP is an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion
Reviews.Author: Sacred Courage
Reviews.Content: The HP Pavilion is truly a state of the art laptop. The HP Pavilion can do almost anything! Try it!

Reviews.Title: as expected
Reviews.Author: James W Borum
Reviews.Content: As expected no surprises works well.  Is rather large for a laptop but it is what I wanted. Good purchase.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: ME Boone
Reviews.Content: I haven't had this laptop for very long but so far so good...although Windows 8 is proving to be a challenge to get use to.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: bobby
Reviews.Content: this is a great computer does everything I need .easy set up and easy use not used for work so it does everything for play and emails and finances would recommend

Reviews.Title: desktop replacement
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: bought this as a desktop replacement for xp that was hot upgradeable.Does just what we wanted and is movable, a little heavy to pass as portable.Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Ronda L. Henderson "light seeker"
Reviews.Content: This laptop is everything I wanted to use for my business use only. I love the fact that the screen is large, allowing you to open multiple windows at once, but it is fast, thin and lightweight. This is a very good computer for the money and for most computer users.

Reviews.Title: Had to return it, 5 stars for Amazon
Reviews.Author: Drue "Drue"
Reviews.Content: It has some sort of bios issue that caused it to need rebooting (via battery removal)  each and every time it was shut down or even just went into sleep mode due to inactivity.  Learned this only after 2 days of installing and updating.  Very frustrating and a huge waste of precious time.  Amazon took it back, absolutely no hassle!!!  And then when UPS lost my return package (I waited 10 days) they issued me a credit anyway.  The return package did eventually get found and returned to Amazon.  For me, the HP Pavillion was a dud but it was almost worth it to be treated so well by Amazon.  The computer gets one star, Amazon gets 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Brilliant
Reviews.Author: kyra drew
Reviews.Content: I am still learning all the new things I can do. So far I love it. The screen is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Very nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: Works very well. Big so I can see it. I'm still leaning the windows 8 tho. Order came on time with nothing wrong with it. Happy with my new laptop.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Dean R Heim
Reviews.Content: Works well for everything I use it for. Would have given it a 5 but they shrunk down the keyboard in order to fit in speakers.

Reviews.Title: Recommended Buy
Reviews.Author: Joseph Reese
Reviews.Content: I have been using this laptop for over a month now and it is just as described.  I use it for school work and light gaming, and it performs well.  The only thing that keeps it from getting the full five stars is that twice the fan has powered on and accelerated without stopping and with no apparent cause.  The only solution was to pull the battery (even the power button would not work).  I think this is a fluke, but I have noticed that it correlates with trying to allow the automatic HP updates.  Other than that strange occurrence, it works great!

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Liam
Reviews.Content: I am a first time laptop owner and usually use a pc, but this laptop is great I would recommend getting windows 8.1 though because 8 is bad. The only thing that is bad is shutting down so be patient hold it down, otherwise great laptop.

Reviews.Title: Good lap good tools
Reviews.Author: Hong Luo
Reviews.Content: Pretty good,receive it in 2 days and it really work very well.the screen is really big enough for u to watch movie.the windows 8 system is also very cool.

Reviews.Title: Excellent laptop
Reviews.Author: Veronica
Reviews.Content: It is a good laptop. I happen to like Windows 8 O/S it is good as well. Very heavy, no sound from keys on keyboard which I like. It meets all of my of expectations. Well worth every dime.

Reviews.Title: love the product with windows 8
Reviews.Author: BenjaminJ
Reviews.Content: I went from vista to windows 8 and at first was not ready to make the change. I love the new computer and was very happy with Win 8. I'm happy with the way the computer performs. It works well with my pictures and the programs I am using with them. I like the light weight and sleek look. The laptop is very fast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Decent computer if it didn't have Windows 8.
Reviews.Author: R. kossak "spotted cuscus"
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 can ruin an otherwise good computer. Bought the Walmart version of this model the first time, and it didn't work right out of the box. Turned out to be a defective motherboard. Returned it to Walmart and took a chance buying basically the same model from Amazon. Would be a nice computer if it wasn't for Windows 8. I wish I could have gotten it with Windows 7.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Francisco Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: The laptop works perfectly, the size is confortable if you are going to use it in home or school. Good deal

Reviews.Title: Problems 7 days after I opened it.
Reviews.Author: JAW85
Reviews.Content: I used the computer for about a week and started having problems with the computer not waking up from Sleep mode.  I had to restart the computer completely every time it went into Sleep mode.The problem got worse once I contacted HP Support.  The first person I spoke with asked me to reset the computer to its factory settings.  I was new to Windows 8 and asked for instructions in resetting the computer.  I tried to follow them but I was kept getting an error message stating something was missing from a drive and it could not restart.  I contacted HP again and they said they would send a box for me to send the computer to them and they would repair the problem, I was informed this would take about nine days.  After only having the computer for 7 days I told them this was unacceptable and they could sending a new computer would be the only resolution to this problem that I would be satisfied with.  I was informed a Case Manager would contact me shortly.  I started playing around in the settings and got the computer to reset itself to factory settings.  This was really aggravating, your Support Tech could not give proper instructions and with Google and 10 minutes I was able to get the reset started.  A couple hours after the reset was done the problem was still not fixed.  I contacted Amazon, returned the product and went back to Toshiba.  I was tried HP because of a suggestion from a friend and the price of the product.  Never again will I return, mostly because of their poor service.Two days after I sent the HP back for a refund I got a call for the Case Manager apologizing about the problem and asked if I could send the computer in so they could fix it.  After explaining how disappointed I was in their product and poor Tech Support I told her I returned the product and was going back to Toshiba which I have used for years.  She apologized again then offered an extended warranty on any HP computer.Thanks for nothing HP!

Reviews.Title: POOR CUSTOMER SUPPORT.
Reviews.Author: SANDY JEAN SHUFELT
Reviews.Content: Week one.  Had issues with BIOS.  When  I called tech support it was the worst experience I have EVER encountered.  I will not recommend anyone to use HP support.  My issue was resolved with a Microsoft support tech that knew exactly what my issue was and informed me what I had to do to resolve it.  I believe having support is NOT hiring idiots from another country to try to resolve issues they have NO knowledge of.  Bad move on HP part.  I am very disappointed in the service I received and will NOT purchase another HP product.

Reviews.Title: much improved over its predecessor
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: Powered by Intel's new Haswell processor, this laptop is much better than its predecessor, 17-e020us. Easy to set up, easy to use, fast, powerful. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a 17-inch laptop.

Reviews.Title: Huge laptop and terrible screen resolution
Reviews.Author: C. Wu
Reviews.Content: I bought a apple air last year.  I love the screen and the speed.  I like everything of Applie air other than it does not have adobe flash.  Some window programs in the website does not run in apple, so I decide to get a window laptop.  Trying to have basicly the same speed, and RAM.I guess that you should always go to store to look at the computer before buying it.  I was shocked that this is sooo heavy. I can tolerate this.  The window 8 is a headackes compare with my HP pc has vista (that used to be a headache too).  It is very slow.  When I tried to stream movie from Amazon, the screen is very blue.  I can not figure out how to adjust the color.  The resolution is terrible (may be I am used to Apple Air's resolution.)  I just hate it.  I tried for a few weeks, even bought a few program for window 8.  I deicide that I can not live with this giant and I will try to return.I would not recommand this.  I do not know it is the problem of the laptop or window 8.  It is terribly slow with 2.4 ghz...
